articles.content:
Joint meeting of artistes
   Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) --A joint friendly meeting between Korean artistes in Pyongyang and participants in the 17th April Spring Friendship Art Festival was held at the Central Youth Hall on Sunday.   Participants in the meeting talked about the festival which decorated Sun' s Day significantly, and deepened friendship, singing and dancing together.

articles.content:
Foreign party delegations visit Pyongyang mission of Hanminjon
    Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Delegations of the Communist Party of Germany, the Mongolian People's Revolutionary Party and the Worker's Party of Mexico visited the Pyongyang mission of the National Democratic Front of South Korea (Hanminjon) on April 18.Chief of the mission Pak Kwang Gi informed guests of the activities  of Hanminjon and said that the South Korean people will make a new turning-point in the struggle against foreign forces and for independence and the movement for national reunification.   The heads of the delegations highly estimated the activities of Hanminjon and expressed their firm determination to fully support the Korean people's struggle for the country's reunification.

Demo and sit-in strike of S. Korean students
articles.content:
Demo and sit-in strike of S. Korean students
   Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Students under the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) on Saturday waged a protest demonstration as the police totally blocked Hongik University, the venue of a meeting of deputies to the 7th-term Hanchongryon, a Seoul-based radio reported.   The South Korean authorities deployed over 10,000 policemen at the university and other places of Seoul to break up the meeting.

articles.title: Withdrawal of "bill on reform of cooperatives" called for
articles.content:
Withdrawal of "bill on reform of cooperatives" called for
    Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- More than 20,000 stockbreeders held a meeting in Seoul against the authority's anti-social "bill on reform of cooperatives" on April 18, according to a radio report from Seoul.   Saying that the bill put forward by the authorities was unilaterally decided  in the absence of stockbreeders, victims, they strongly urged the authorities to immediately withdraw it.   They adopted a resolution carrying their demand and  declared they would continue to struggle until the "bill on reform" was withdrawn.

articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from the central committee of the Communist Party of Germany and the workers home of Iran.   The gifts were separately handed to officials concerned by Hans Wauer, vice-chairman of the c.c., the Communist Party of Germany who is leading its delegation, and Mohammad Hamzeh, head of the delegation of the Workers Home of Iran, on visit to the DPRK.

Kim Jong Il receives gift from World Council of Churches
   Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting delegation of the World Council of Churches.It was handed to an official concerned by general secretary Konrad Raiser, head of the delegation.

Kim Yong Nam meets delegation of World Council of Churches
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets delegation of World Council of Churches
   Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the visiting delegation of the World Council of Churches led by its general secretary Konrad Raiser at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.   The head of the delegation said that during his visit to Korea, he saw at first hand many achievements made by the Korean people in their struggle for future.  He said he was confident that the Korean people have strength and potentiality to tide over the natural disasters that hit their country for several consecutive years.
